snippet.title: USC students building a working Holodeck
snippet.description: Project Holodeck makes use of Oculus Rift, PlayStation Move, and Razer Hydra to create virtual-reality gaming.

snippet.title: Ep. 39: Trojans and tablets
snippet.description: Hackers unlock Google Music Sync service and the Motorola Atrix 4G's webtop interface. Motorola announces that it'll upgrade your hacked Xoom. Meanwhile, the Android Market's trojan app fiasco gets much more complex with the announcement of a malicious version of Google's own Android Security Tool. All of that and more on this week's edition of Android Atlas Weekly with Justin Eckhouse and Antuan Goodwin.

snippet.title: Android Atlas Weekly 39: Trojans and tablets (podcast)
snippet.description: Hackers unlock Google Music Sync service and the Motorola Atrix 4G's webtop interface. Motorola announces that it'll upgrade your hacked Xoom. All of that and more on this week's edition of Android Atlas Weekly with Justin Eckhouse and Antuan Goodwin.

snippet.title: Trojans still Greek to Mac Users
snippet.description: Although the infamous DNSChanger (also known as OSX.RSPLUG or perhaps osx.trojan-2) has been circulating the Internet for some time, people are still experiencing the effects from it's devious ruse. The following article is a breakdown of what the DNSChan

snippet.title: Security tips for avoiding Trojans and malicious software
Five ways to keep your PC free of viruses and Trojans
snippet.description: Malware authors are finding sneaky new ways to separate you from your financial data and other sensitive information.

snippet.title: Microsoft: Trojans are huge and China is tops in browser exploits
snippet.description: The Microsoft Security Intelligence Report shows Trojans continue to dominate the field of malware, emerging markets are at greater risk for infection, and vulnerability rates are going down overall.

snippet.title: Mac Malware Update: Unauthorized downloads of Snow Leopard infested with Trojans
snippet.description: Several Web sites have sprung up over the last couple days offering users free upgrades of Apple's latest operating system, Mac OS X 10.6 Snow Leopard. Of course, these sites are socially engineered ploys to trick users into downloading malicious software

snippet.title: Trojans exploit Mac OS X ARDAgent flaw
snippet.description: A group of hackers are working to create a collection of exploits a vulnerability within Mac OS X 10.4 and 10.5.

snippet.title: Yahoo's Right Media had Trojans in banner ads
snippet.description: Popular Web sites like MySpace and Photobucket has banner ads containing malicious code that could lead to the compromise of a computer.
